metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3421 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the RPM package in the read functionality. This flaw allows an attacker who can convince a victim to install a seemingly verifiable package or compromise an RPM repository, to cause RPM database corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity. This flaw affects RPM versions before 4.17.0-alpha.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Only debugedit and librpmio9 binary packages are in main, and triaged with view to how they are used in the build process as described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rpm/+bug/1913871

criterions.comment: rpm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
